Posts.Content: lindamcm wrote: I just finished up 3 rounds of TC and 1 round of AC (due to hive reaction to T) and am now deciding whether to take tamoxifen for 5 years.  I am not keen on taking a drug with so many known side effects for so long and am considering having my ovaries removed instead.  I am 46 years old and done having kids.  Does anyone have any advice, experience or comments you can share?  Thanks! Posts.Content: May 26, 2010 03:46PM lindamcm wrote: My doc said that the adrenal gland produces estrogen also so ovary removal would not turn off all of the estrogen.  Even with the ovaries removed I would still have to take a drug called Femara for 5 years.  It is for post-menopausa women.  So, I guess I will try the tamoxifen and see what side effects occur.  No sense having another surgery if I still have to take a drug.  I hope this helps.
